result.execSummary:
The defendant Keller G McQuay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possess Short-barreled Shotgun/Rifle, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.28(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: It is the courts intention that the Department of Corrections can take 50% from all  money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Statutory costs assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Must not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances unless by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.   No contact, directly or indirectly, with the victim (person, property, residence or family). Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Body armor warning given. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Court Reporter:  Carolyn Kinglsley.  Defendant Keller G McQuay in court with attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz.  Defendant Keller G McQuay in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams and Lillian Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Two additional letters in support of the defendant were viewed by the attorneys and the court.
No additions or corrections to PSI by the State or defense. 
State indicated they are Chapter 950 compliant.

Three statements by victim's family.

State requests on 15CF1353 Count 1: 35 years IC & 20 years ES.  Count 2:  5 years IC & 5 years ES consecutive to count 1.   Count 3:  3 years IC & 3 years ES consecutive.   On resisting charge, 9 months consecutive.   On battery by prisoner 1 1/2 years IC & 3 years consecutive.

Defense requests on Count 1:  15-20 years IC & 8-10 years ES.   Count 2:  2 years IC & 2 years ES concurrent.  Count 3:  18 months IC & 18 months ES concurrent.  On battery by prisoner:  2 years probation consecutive and on resisting 4-6 months concurrent.  No objection to restitution claim.

BTC:  on 15CF1353 count 1:  WPS 55 years (35 years IC & 20 years ES)
No alcohol or c/s unless prescribed by a physician, random UA's & breathalyzers
Any treatment recommended by agent
no contact, directly or indirectly, with victim, victim's family or relatives
Restitution $4,664.62 to WJ or Crime Victims Compensation Fund if appropriate.
NO CIP or SAT.
Firearms/voting warnings
NO body armor.

count 2:  WPS 6 years (3 years IC & 3 years ES) consecutive to count 1
same conditions

count 3:  WPS 4 years ( 2 years IC & 2 years ES)  consecutive to counts 1 & 2
same conditions

15CF1617 - 9 months RCJ - concurrent to others

15CF817 WPS 3 years (1 1/2 years IC & 1 1/2 years ES)  consecutive to others
same conditions

Sex offender registry as previously ordered.
Costs including DNA assment on all counts
CFTS - may bring back to court if disagrees with accounting

Per the judge, the status conference for tomorrow may be cancelled if he receives confirmation that a new attorney has accepted Mr. McQuay's case and that he/she will be available for the sentencing date.  Confirmation received and status conference cancelled.

Court Reporter Leslie Johnson. Defendant Keller G McQuay in court with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  Defendant Keller G McQuay in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams and Lillian Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  on Atty Frost's Motion to Withdraw.

Per Atty Frost, defendant has requested a change in counsel.  Public Defender's office will appoint new counsel.
Per Atty Tanck-Adams, they are unsure of what this withdrawal would involve.

BTC:  Defendant can discharge his attorney, however, the public defender is providing counsel and they can only be discharged under certain circumstances.

Per Atty Frost, defendant feels he is receiving ineffective counsel and counsel is not working to his benefit.  He has an issue with the entire case, not just the plea.  

BTC:  Motion to Withdraw granted.  Atty Frost to forward her file to the public defender's office and provide an order.  Sentencing for 2-26-18 will remain.  Status conference to be set for next week to ensure new counsel is appointed, Atty Frost need not be present, but must notify public defender of this status conference and someone from there must appear, either new counsel or someone from P.D. office to explain why new counsel not appointed yet.  Status conference scheduled for January 11, 2018 at 09:00 am.

Per the State, new physical abuse element per texts warrant intentional homicide charge rather than wreckless homicide.
Per the defense, this should have been discovered earlier and there is a significant change from a Class A to a Class B felony.  

BTC:   State will have greater burden, but motion to amend information granted.   In order for Atty Frost to have sufficient time to prepare for trial in this matter, trial date will be adjourned.   State to file amended information and hearing will be held with next motion hearing.

BTC:  Video is not panoramic evidence, second person should be redacted, but video too prejudicial to use as chase in chief.   If Defendant chooses to testify  it may be used for impeachment.  Atty Tanck-Adams to prepare the order.

State requests their request be revisited if video can ge dated.   GRANTED.

Court Reporter:  Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant Keller G McQuay in court with attorneys Katie Gutowski and Mindy Nolan.  Defendant Keller G McQuay in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin. on Defendant's Denny Motion.  

Per Atty Nolan, testimony evidence only, Denny factors gone through.
Time taken for defense counsel to confer with client.
Defendant's rights given, no cross by state to be allowed today.
Offer of proof put on the record. 
Keller McQuay - DSAT - his sister was also present at the time of the incident. 

State puts objection to motion on the record.

BTC:  Must be a showing of fact greater than only the third party being present.  No testimony provided that SK had any reason to be involved.  Legitimate tendancy test not met.  Motion denied.  State to prepare the order.  

Per the State, issue with items sent to Crime Lab.  Chris Johnson, supervisor of DNA unit, reached by phone.  He will check with analyst and call back.

Per Atty Nolan, speedy trial demand filed today.

Regarding State's motions recently filed, 10 days for defense to respond.  Motion date set.

Mr. Johnson called back and testing will be done by 4-17-17.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 3, 2017 at 11:00 am.
